titles.title: The Trees They Do Grow High

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: The trees they do grow high, And the leaves they do grow green, But the time is gone and past, my love, That you and I have see. It's a cold winter's night, my love, And here I must abide alone. My bonny lad was young, but a growing.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: "O, Father, dearest Father, I fear you've done me wrong, For you've married me to a bonny boy, But I fear he is too young." "O, my daughter, dearest daughter, If you stay at home a time with me, A lady you shall be, while he is growing?"

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: "We'll send him to a college, But for a year or two, And then perhaps in time, my love, Into a man he'll grow. I will buy you a ribbon blue To tie about his bonny waist, To let the ladies know that he's married."

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: At the age of sixteen, He was a married man, And at the age of seventeen, He was father of a son, And at the age of eighteen, His grave it was growing green, And that did put an end to his growing.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: She made her love a shroud Of the holland, O so fine, And ev'ry stitch she put in it, Her tears came trickling down. "O, once I had a sweetheart, But now I have got never a one, So fare you well my true love for ever."

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: The trees they do grow high, And the leaves they do grow green, But the time is gone and past, my love, That you and I have see. It's a cold winter's night, my love, And here I must abide alone. My bonny lad was young, but a growing.
